SENT.plain: Hypertension was produced in 8 cats by nephrectomy and wrapping the opposite kidney
Subsequent occlusion of one middle cerebral artery caused ischemic infarcts that were larger than those of 8 normotensive cats
The larger infarcts may have been caused by increases of ischemic cerebral edema resulting from changes in the cerebral endothelial barrier induced by hypertension
In addition to increasing the likelihood of strokes, hypertension in humans may predispose toward larger cerebral infarcts
